metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1095 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ext4_xattr_check_entries function in fs/ext4/xattr.c in the Linuxkernel through 4.15.15 does not properly validate xattr sizes, which causesmisinterpretation of a size as an error code, and consequently allowsattackers to cause a denial of service (get_acl NULL pointer dereferenceand system crash) via a crafted ext4 image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1095` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-24.26
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-24.26
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-24.26

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
